block.p: Carroll Seabrook Leatherman, the daughter of Donna Riso Leatherman of New York and the late S. R. Leatherman IV of Memphis, was married last evening to William Carlisle Brett, the son of Julie S. Brett and William J. Brett of Westwood, Mass. The Rev. Anthony Schueller, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Jean Baptiste in New York.

The bride, 27, is a senior associate in New York with Korn/Ferry, the executive search firm. She graduated from the University of North Carolina. Her mother owns an art gallery in New York. Her father founded Memphis Chair, furniture makers in Bruce, Miss.

Carroll Seabrook Leatherman, the daughter of Donna Riso Leatherman of New York and the late S. R. Leatherman IV of Memphis, was married last evening to William Carlisle Brett, the son of Julie S. Brett and William J. Brett of Westwood, Mass. The Rev. Anthony Schueller, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Jean Baptiste in New York.

Carroll Seabrook Leatherman, the daughter of Donna Riso Leatherman of New York and the late S. R. Leatherman IV of Memphis, was married last evening to William Carlisle Brett, the son of Julie S. Brett and William J. Brett of Westwood, Mass. The Rev. Anthony Schueller, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Jean Baptiste in New York.

The bride, 27, is a senior associate in New York with Korn/Ferry, the executive search firm. She graduated from the University of North Carolina. Her mother owns an art gallery in New York. Her father founded Memphis Chair, furniture makers in Bruce, Miss.

The bridegroom, 30, markets and structures risk management transactions in New York for the Bank of America. He graduated from Harvard. His father is the president of Barclay Water Management, a water-treatment firm in Watertown, Mass.
